channel.title: So my area suffered a severe flood on Friday. [Updated]
channel.description:
Yeah due to heavy rain (a months worth of rain in just a few hours) on friday my village and the surrounding towns suffered a severe flood (worst its ever been) The river here is below a 15-20ft wall as part of the flood defence and it came up and over onto the main road I've taken too many photos to post onto here so ill just post my facebook album which hopefully if i've set it up right everybody can view, It has been on national news and in the national papers also.. my boss was on radio 5 live and also calender news and i think Sky news too.
But anyway, my place of work, needs a whole new renovation as it was up to my stomach in water and it backlogged all the toilets so it all has to be sanitized too, the flood in the side restaraunt has bulged up about 7-8 inches and im out of work for a good couple of weeks.
Hopefully the pictures will explain everything and show everything but yeah :D Water was even flowing down my street which it has never done also.
Heres the link to the album... if it doesnt work i will just upload a few of the photos to here.
[url=http://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.10151071424411393.488202.716906392&type=3]Facebook[/url]
PS if anyone knows how to get it so It shows for example "link here" instead of the full URL I have forgotton -.-
Just to give you an idea.. the average level for the river in my village is around 1metre... on friday it reached 4.29m
BBC In pictures:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-leeds-18563258
for those that cant see the album here are a selection... Also if people want to see what the river is like usually let me know.
[img]http://a4.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-snc7/s720x720/579961_10151071428396393_367205776_n.jpg[/img] [img]http://a7.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-ash4/s720x720/481305_10151071428036393_876694950_n.jpg[/img] [img]http://a2.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-snc6/s720x720/250775_10151071429306393_996691969_n.jpg[/img] [img]http://a8.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-snc6/s720x720/252625_10151071430201393_996746445_n.jpg[/img]
When it was dark the river was actually coming over this bit of the wall
[img]http://a4.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-ash4/s720x720/208902_10151071425176393_1427052484_n.jpg[/img] [img]http://a7.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-ash3/s720x720/543290_10151071426366393_528851560_n.jpg[/img]
Again when it was dark the river was up to the top of the banner
[img]http://a3.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-ash3/s720x720/599481_10151071426016393_477715730_n.jpg[/img]
A brand new BMW X5 police car that had got stuck, On the LED board in the back window it said "flood"... Made me chuckle.
My work place yesterday
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BURM_C5oimo

item.title: So my area suffered a severe flood on Friday. [Updated]
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

I agree, it looks like a nice place to live – floodwater notwithstanding. Seriously, that’s intense considering it happened in just hours.

Read full topic
item.source: So my area suffered a severe flood on Friday. [Updated]

item.title: So my area suffered a severe flood on Friday. [Updated]
item.dc:creator: @archerer98 Archer
item.description:
@archerer98 wrote:

Frell:

European towns are beautiful

That is really all I was thinking looking at the pics lol.

Read full topic
item.source: So my area suffered a severe flood on Friday. [Updated]

item.title: So my area suffered a severe flood on Friday. [Updated]
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

Having said that boot, There were four cars in the pub carpark. my dad managed to get my boss’s Vauxhall corsa out… it was almost floating, and it was weaving from side to side as he drove it out… There were two cars instantly written off and my dads landrover Discovery TD5 which was in part of the deepest bit started first time in the morning The water was up to the bonnet.

Read full topic
item.source: So my area suffered a severe flood on Friday. [Updated]

item.description:

I hate facebook, who even has facebook… Upload the photos somewhere else please!
[/quote]

Everything is public… you should be able to see it? There is over 90 photos so uploading elsewhere will take too long Ill post a few here[/quote]

If it helps, I don’t have facebook…

This content is currently unavailable
The page you requested cannot be displayed at the moment. It may be temporarily unavailable, the link you clicked on may have expired, or you may not have permission to view this page.

The few you’ve posted are pretty astonishing really… nothing a land rover couldn’t handle!

item.title: So my area suffered a severe flood on Friday. [Updated]
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:10, topic:446907”]It rained for 72 hours straight here because of a tropical storm, no floods though. Our country hasn’t been populated long enough to pack the ground tight so water was easily absorbed.[/quote]Say that to the US Amazonas (Louisiana)

item.title: So my area suffered a severe flood on Friday. [Updated]
item.dc:creator: @classic mopmans little slave
item.description:
@classic wrote:

TheBeanie:

The one with the police car… It was a brand new BMW X5 that got stuck… we had to wade behind it as the river was overflowing the wall on the otherside (which at normal levels is about 20ft down) and it was up to our waists behind the car. it was actually coming OVER the bridge too :S

Holy crap.

Frell:

European towns are beautiful

lul

Read full topic
